Legal_Issue: Whether the Tribunal erred in dismissing the Applicant's claim of discrimination based on race, ethnic or national origin, and colour
Application_Facts: Mr. Khiamal alleged racial bias in Greyhound's hiring process, claiming he was not promoted to Foreman due to his race
Decision_Outcome: The Tribunal's decision was found unreasonable; judicial review granted
Court_Ruling: The matter is remitted to a differently constituted tribunal for re-determination
Defendant_Behavior: Greyhound's hiring decision influenced by personal animosity; potential racial bias not adequately assessed
Grounds_for_Claim: Race, national or ethnic origin, colour
Legal_Standard: Prima facie case of discrimination; burden shifting framework
Assessment_Factor: Influence of personal animosity vs. racial factors in hiring decision
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under section 18.1 of the Federal Courts Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Canadian Human Rights Act provisions on employment discrimination
Application_Basis: Refusal of promotion based on protected grounds
Evidence_Assessed: Failure to consider statistical data and whether race was a contributing factor
Relief_Sought: Judicial review and re-determination of discrimination claim
Governing_Rule: It is discriminatory under the Canadian Human Rights Act to refuse employment based on race, national or ethnic origin, or colour
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Tribunal failed to analyze whether race was a factor and ignored statistical evidence
Outcome: Judicial review granted; case remitted for re-determination
Harm_Assessment: Potential discriminatory denial of promotion affecting employment opportunity
Cause_Description: Alleged racial bias in Greyhound's failure to promote Mr. Khiamal to Foreman
Evidence_Handling: Statistical evidence of under-representation not properly considered
Legal_Provision_Violated: Canadian Human Rights Act - Prohibition of employment discrimination based on race, colour, national or ethnic origin
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient analysis of race as a factor; omission of relevant statistical data
Evidence_Assessment: Tribunal did not adequately assess whether discrimination played a role
Decision_Rationale: Decision unreasonable due to failure to assess animus in context of discrimination and ignoring key evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider statistical evidence and intersection of animosity with racial factors
Legal_Standard_Applied: Prima facie discrimination standard under human rights law
